nl.strohalm.cyclos.access
Interface PermissionCheck

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPermissionCheck
public interface PermissionCheck

Used to check for permissions according to the logged user. If a check is to accept a given user type (administrator / member / broker / operator), a call to the corresponding method must be done, even if without permissions. Otherwise, for example, if the logged user is a member and the member(MemberPermission...) method was not invoked, the permission will be denied.

Author:
luis

admin

PermissionCheck admin(AdminPermission... permissions)
Adds a permission check for administrators

adminFor

PermissionCheck adminFor(AdminPermission permission,
                         Entity... entityToCheck)
Adds a check to administrators that ensures ALL entities must belong to the collection represented by the given administrator permission.

Parameters:
permission - a permission which type must be LIST.
a - list of entities to check on an AND basis.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the permission's type is not LIST.

void check()
           throws PermissionDeniedException
Throws a PermissionDeniedException if the result of check() is false

Throws:
PermissionDeniedException

hasPermission

boolean hasPermission()
Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the logged user is allowed according to the current permissions. A list of permissions is checked on an OR basis: if any one of the permissions is valid, it returns true.

member

PermissionCheck member(MemberPermission... permissions)
Adds a permission check for members

memberFor

PermissionCheck memberFor(MemberPermission permission,
                          Entity... entitiesToCheck)
Adds a check to members that ensures ALL entities must belong to the collection represented by the given member permission.

Parameters:
permission - a permission which type must be LIST.
a - list of entities to check on an AND basis.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the permission's type is not LIST.

operator

PermissionCheck operator()
Adds a permission check for operators with no permissions. This one exists so calls with empty args will compile. Otherwise, the compiler doesn't know which method to invoke: operator(OperatorPermission...) or operator(MemberPermission...)

operator

PermissionCheck operator(MemberPermission... permissions)
Adds a permission check for operators, but checking his member's permissions

operator

Adds a permission check for operators

operatorFor

PermissionCheck operatorFor(OperatorPermission permission,
                            Entity... entityToCheck)
Adds a check to operators that ensures ALL entities must belong to the collection represented by the given operator permission.

Parameters:
permission - a permission which type must be LIST.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the permission's type is not LIST.

operatorFor

PermissionCheck operatorFor(OperatorPermission permission,
                            MemberPermission parentPermission,
                            Entity... entities)
Adds a check to operators that ensures ALL entities must belong to the collection represented by the given member permission and that also has the required operator permission. This method is useful when the operator permission is a boolean but the parent member permission has a relationship and we want to ensure that all entities are allowed for the owner member.

Parameters:
permission - a permission which type must be LIST.
parentPermission - a permission which type must be BOOLEAN.
entities - a list of entities to check on an AND basis.
Returns:
